00047 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00048 
00049 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00050 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00051 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00052 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00053 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00054 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00055 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00056 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00057 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00058 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00060 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00061 
00062 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00063 
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00065 
00066 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00067 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00068 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00069 
00070 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00071 
00072     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00076 
00077 {
00078     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00079     spl_t flags;
00080 
00081     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00082 
00083     adeos_load_cpuid();
00084 
00085     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00086         {
00087         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00088             /* Use a non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00089                bit_spin_lock. */
00090             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1, lock))
00091                 cpu_relax();
00092         }
00093     else
00094         flags |= 2;
00095 
00096     return flags;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00100 
00101 {
00102     if (!(flags & 2))
00103         {
00104         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00105 
00106         rthal_cli();
00107 
00108         adeos_load_cpuid();
00109 
00110         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00111             {
00112             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00113             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00114             }
00115         }
00116 
00117     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00118 }
00119 
00120 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00121 
00122 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00123 
00124 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00125 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00126 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00127 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00128 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00129 
00130 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00183 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00184 
00185     /* Kernel mode side */
00186 
00187 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00188     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00189        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00190     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00191     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00192     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00193     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00194        - NULL for RT K threads,
00195        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00196        - current for RT US threads.
00197     */
00198 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00199 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00200 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00201 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00202 
00203     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00204     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00205     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00206     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00207 
00208     /* User mode side */
00209     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00210     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00211 
00212     /* Init block */
00213     struct xnthread *self;
00214     int imask;
00215     const char *name;
00216     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00217     void *cookie;
00218 
00219 } xnarchtcb_t;

00245 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00246     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00247 }
00248 
00249 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00250     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00251 }
00252 
00253 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00254     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00255 }
00256 
00257 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00258     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00259 }

00261 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00262     return adeos_processor_id();
00263 }

00265 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00266 
00267 {
00268 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00269     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00270         return vmalloc(bytes);
00271 #endif
00272 
00273     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00274 }
00275 
00276 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00277 
00278 {
00279 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00280     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00281         vfree(chunk);
00282     else
00283 #endif
00284         kfree(chunk);
00285 }

00291 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00292 do { \
00293     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00294     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00295     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00296     for (;;) ;                          \
00297 } while(0)

00302 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00303 
00304 {
00305     spl_t s;
00306     splhigh(s);
00307     splexit(!!imask);
00308     return !!s;
00309 }

00370 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00371 
00372 {
00373     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00374 
00375     adeos_load_cpuid();
00376 
00377     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00378        and always inside a critical section. */
00379     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00380     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00381     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00382 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00383     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00384     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00385     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00386                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00387                     : NULL);
00388 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00389 }
00390 
00391 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00392     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00393 }
00394 
00395 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00396                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00397 {
00398     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00399     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00400 
00401     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00402 
00403     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00404         {
00405         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00406 
00407         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00408 
00409 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00410         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00411            they don't work properly in our context. */
00412         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00413             asm volatile (
00414                 "dssall;\n"
00415 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00416                 "sync;\n"
00417 #endif
00418                 : : );
00419         }
00420 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00421 
00422         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00423         get_mmu_context(mm);
00424         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00425 
00426 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00427         if (next->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == next)
00428             next->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00429 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00430 
00431 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00432         if (next->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == next)
00433             next->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00434 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00435 
00436         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00437 
00438         barrier();
00439         }
00440     else
00441         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00442         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00443 }
00444 
00445 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00446                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00447 {
00448     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00449 }
00450 
00451 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00452 
00453 {
00454     /* Empty */
00455 }
00456 
00457 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00458                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00459                                          const char *name)
00460 {
00461     tcb->user_task = current;
00462     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00463     tcb->ksp = 0;
00464     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00465 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00466     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00467     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00468 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00469     tcb->entry = NULL;
00470     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00471     tcb->self = thread;
00472     tcb->imask = 0;
00473     tcb->name = name;
00474 }
00475 
00476 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00477 
00478 {
00479     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00480     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00481     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00482     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00483 }
00484 
00485 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00486                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00487                                        void *cookie,
00488                                        int imask,
00489                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00490                                        char *name)
00491 {
00492     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00493 
00494     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00495 
00496     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00497     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00498     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00499     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00500     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00501     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00502 
00503     tcb->entry = entry;
00504     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00505     tcb->self = thread;
00506     tcb->imask = imask;
00507     tcb->name = name;
00508 }
00509 
00510 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00511 
00512 {
00513 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00514     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00515         rthal_enable_fpu();
00516 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00517 }
00518 
00519 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00520 
00521 {
00522 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00523     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00524        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00525     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00526     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00527 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00528 }
00529 
00530 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00531 
00532 {
00533 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00534 
00535     if(tcb->fpup)
00536         {
00537         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00538 
00539         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00540             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00541         }   
00542 
00543 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00544 }
00545 
00546 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00547 
00548 {
00549 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00550 
00551     if(tcb->fpup)
00552         {
00553         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00554 
00555         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00556             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00557         }   
00558 
00559     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00560        could be much lazier. */
00561     if(tcb->user_task)
00562         rthal_disable_fpu();
00563 
00564 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00565 }

00569 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00570 
00571     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00572 }
00573 
00574 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00575 
00576 {
00577     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00578                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00579                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00580                                      NULL,
00581                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00582 }
00583 
00584 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00585 
00586 {
00587     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00588                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00589                                      NULL,
00590                                      NULL,
00591                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00592 }

00599 }

00623 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00624 
00625 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00626 
00627 {
00628 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00629     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00630        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00631     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00632 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00633 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00634     xnshadow_release_events();
00635 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00636     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00637     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00638     schedule_timeout(50);
00639     xnarch_release_ipi();
00640 }
00641 
00642 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00643 
00644 {
00645     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00646 
00647     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00648         {
00649         spl_t s;
00650         splsync(s);
00651         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00652         splexit(s);
00653         return 1;
00654         }
00655 
00656     return 0;
00657 }
00658 
00659 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00660 
00661 {
00662 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00663     xnshadow_grab_events();
00664 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00665 }
00666 
00667 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00668 
00669 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00670 
00671 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00672 
00673     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00674     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00675     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00676 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00677     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00678     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00679 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00680     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00681 }
00682 
00683 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00684 
00685 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00686 
00687 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00688                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00689                                            const char *name)
00690 {
00691     struct task_struct *task = current;
00692 
00693     tcb->user_task = task;
00694     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00695     tcb->ksp = 0;
00696     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00697 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00698     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00699     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00700 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00701     tcb->entry = NULL;
00702     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00703     tcb->self = thread;
00704     tcb->imask = 0;
00705     tcb->name = name;
00706 }
00707 
00708 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00709 
00710 {
00711     unsigned irq;
00712 
00713     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00714         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00715                              handler,
00716                              NULL,
00717                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00718 
00719     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00720        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00721        individually. */
00722 
00723     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00724                          handler,
00725                          NULL,
00726                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00727 }
00728 
00729 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00730 
00731 {
00732     unsigned irq;
00733 
00734     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00735         {
00736         switch (irq)
00737             {
00738 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00739             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00740 
00741                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00742                 continue;
00743 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00744 
00745             default:
00746 
00747                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00748             }
00749         }
00750 
00751     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00752 }
00753 
00754 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00755 
00756 {
00757     unsigned irq;
00758 
00759     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00760         {
00761         switch (irq)
00762             {
00763 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00764             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00765 
00766                 continue;
00767 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00768 
00769             default:
00770 
00771                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00772             }
00773         }
00774 
00775     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00776 }
00777 
00778 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00779 
00780 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00781 
00782 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00783     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00784        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00785        for now. If a timer needs more, a spurious but harmless call to
00786        the tick handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. Since the
00787        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00788        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00789     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00790 }
00791 
00792 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00793     rthal_release_timer();
00794 }
00795 
00796 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00797 
00798 {
00799 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00800     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00801 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00802     return 0;
00803 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00804 }
00805 
00806 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00807                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00808                                         unsigned long long defval)
00809 {
00810 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00811     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00812     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00813     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00814 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00815     *shot = defval;
00816     *delivery = defval;
00817 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00818 }
00819 
00820 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00827 
00828 {
00829     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00830     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00831     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00832 }

00834 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00835                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00836                                           unsigned long paddr,
00837                                           unsigned long size,
00838                                           pgprot_t prot)
00839 {
00840     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00841 }

00843 #endif /* XENO_HEAP_MODULE */
00844 
00845 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00846 
00847 #include <linux/init.h>
00848 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00849 
00850 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00851 
00852 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00853 
00854 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00855 
00856 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00857 
00858 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00859 
00860 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00861 
00862 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00863 
00864 {
00865     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00866     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00867     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00868 }
00869 
00870 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00871 
00872 {
00873 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00874     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00875 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00876     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00877        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00878     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer()) ?: 1;
00879 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00880 }
00881 
00882 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00883 
00884 {
00885     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00886 
00887     if (!nktimerlat)
00888         return -ENODEV;
00889 
00890     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00891 
00892     return 0;
00893 }
00894 
00895 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00896 
00897 {
00898     int err;
00899 
00900 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00901     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00902        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00903     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00904 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00905 
00906     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00907 
00908     if (err)
00909         return err;
00910 
00911     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00912 
00913     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00914         return -ENOSYS;
00915 
00916     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00917                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00918                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00919                               NULL,
00920                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00921 
00922     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00923 
00924 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00925     err = xnshadow_mount();
00926 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00927 
00928     if (err)
00929         {
00930         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00931         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00932         }
00933 
00934     return err;
00935 }
00936 
00937 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00938 
00939 {
00940 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00941     xnshadow_cleanup();
00942 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00943     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00944     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00945 }
00946 
00947 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00948 
00949 #ifdef __cplusplus
00950 }
00951 #endif

00958 #define xnarch_post_graph(obj,state)
00959 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
